item1_summary:
Atmos Energy Corporation is an S&P 500 company headquartered in Dallas and incorporated in Texas and Virginia . We safely deliver reliable, efficient, and abundant natural gas through regulated sales and transportation arrangements to approximately 3.4 million residential, commercial, public authority, and industrial customers . We also operate one of the largest intrastate pipelines in Texas based on miles of pipe .
 At September 30, 2025, we held 1,010 franchises having terms ranging from five to 35 years . We transport natural gas for others through our distribution systems . Purchased gas cost adjustment mechanisms provide a method of recovering purchased gas costs on an ongoing basis without filing a rate case . We believe that we will continue to be able to renew our franchises as they expire .
 Our supply of natural gas is provided by a variety of suppliers, including independent producers, and marketers . Some jurisdictions have performance-based ratemaking adjustments to minimize purchased gas costs through improved storage management and use of financial instruments to reduce volatility in gas costs . The combination of base load and peaking quantities provide flexibility to match increases or decreases in requirements related to weather conditions .
 We estimate our peak-day availability of natural gas supply to be approximately 5.4 Bcf . Peak-day demand for our distribution operations in fiscal 2025 was on February 19, 2025 . Pipeline transportation agreements are firm and many of them have “pipeline no-notice” storage service . These agreements have been negotiated with the shortest term necessary while maintaining our right of first refusal .
 APT is one of the largest intrastate pipeline operations in Texas with a heavy concentration in the established natural gas-producing areas of central, northern, and eastern Texas, extending into or near the major producing areas of the Barnett Shale, the Texas Gulf Coast, and the Permian Basin of West Texas . APT’s existing regulatory mechanisms allow certain transportation and storage services to be provided under market-based rates .
 Gas supply for our distribution division in Louisiana under a long-term contract and, on a more limited basis, to third parties . The demand fee charged to our Louisiana distribution division for these services is subject to regulatory approval by the Louisiana Public Service Commission . We also manage two asset management plans that serve distribution affiliates of the Company .
 The following tables provides a jurisdictional rate summary for our regulated operations as of September 30, 2025 . This information is for regulatory purposes only and may not be representative of our actual financial position . The company has the ability to recover the gas cost portion of bad debts in six states which represents approximately 89 percent of our distribution residential and commercial revenues .
 The rate base, authorized rate of return, debt/equity ratio, and authorized return on equity presented in this table are those from the most recent approved regulatory filing for each jurisdiction . The bad debt rider allows us to recover from customers the gas cost portion of customer accounts that have been written off. This table is not necessarily indicative of current or future rate bases, rates of return or returns on equity .
 The Mid-Tex Cities approved the Formula Rate Mechanism filing with rates effective October 1, 2025 . The Mississippi SRF and SIR were filed jointly in a general rate case . The West Texas Systemwide Statement of Intent filing included the West Texas RRM and the Amarillo, Lubbock, Dalhart and Channing (ALDC), Environs, and Triangle GRIP filings .
 The amounts described in the following sections represent the annual operating income that was requested or received in each rate filing . Ratemaking outcomes include the refund (return) of excess deferred income taxes (EDIT) resulting from previously enacted tax reform legislation . The following ratemaking efforts seeking $231.1 million in annual operating revenue were initiated during fiscal 2025 but had not been completed or impeded .
 The staff of the Kansas Corporation Commission recommended approval of the GSRS filing on October 17, 2025, subject to commission approval . The Kentucky Public Service Commission approved a rate increase of $7.2 million effective October 2, 2025 . The Mid-Tex Cities approved a . rate hike of $138.5 million . We expect rates to be implemented during the first quarter of fiscal 2026 .
 The following table summarizes our annual formula rate mechanisms by state. rrently have specific infrastructure programs in all of our distribution divisions with tariffs in place to permit the investment associated with these programs to have their surcharge rate adjusted annually to recover approved capital costs incurred in a prior test-year period . Infrastructure programs in Texas, Louisiana, and Tennessee allow for the deferral of all expenses associated with capital expenditures incurred pursuant to these rules .
 Atmos Pipeline - Texas. 01/2025                Atmos Pipeline . Atmos pipeline: Atmos, Texas; Atmos; Texas; Pipeline Pipeline: Atmos, Louisiana; Texas, Texas, Louisiana, Texas . Louisiana: Louisiana; Louisiana; Mississippi; Texas: Texas; Louisiana: Mississippi; Louisiana, Mississippi .
 On May 29, 2025, the Kentucky Public Service Commission issued a final order approving the PRP filing . The rate was approved based on the effective date . On October 2, 2024, we implemented the PR P rates subject to refund . The rates were implemented  but however, however, the new were increased for the purposes of the new filing .
 A rate case is a formal request from Atmos Energy to a regulatory authority to increase rates that are charged to customers . Rate cases may also be initiated when the regulatory authorities request us to justify our rates . Adequate rates are intended to provide for recovery of the Company’s costs as well as a reasonable rate of return to our shareholders .
 The Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration (PHMSA) develops and enforces regulations for the safe, reliable, and environmentally sound operation of the pipeline transportation system . The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) allows, pursuant to Section 311 of the Natural Gas Policy Act (NGPA), gas transportation services through our APT assets “on behalf of” interstate pipelines or local distribution companies served by interstate pipelines .
 The U.S. Department of Energy says it has taken necessary steps to comply with regulations . The company says it is not currently in direct competition with other natural gas suppliers . The agency says it does not compete with other suppliers of alternative fuels for sales to industrial customers . The commission says it will continue to work with the U.N. to ensure the public has access to the energy industry .
 At September 30, 2025, we had 5,487 employees . 62 percent of our employees worked in field roles and 38 percent worked in support/shared services roles . None of the employees have chosen to work under a collective bargaining agreement . We strive to have a workforce that reflects the communities we serve . We also target jobs fairs including those focused on minority, veteran, and women candidates .
 The strength of our succession planning process is evident through our long history of promoting most of our leaders from within the organization . The Board of Directors of the Company has established and periodically updated our Corporate Governance Guidelines and Code of Conduct . We will also provide copies of these reports free of charge upon request to Investor Relations at the address and telephone number appearing below .
 The Board of Directors also annually reviews and updates the charters for each of its Audit, Human Resources, Nominating and Corporate Governance, and Corporate Responsibility, Sustainability, and Safety Committees . All of the foregoing documents are posted on our website at www.com/company/corporate-responsiblity-reports .
